message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering the support of high-dimensional sparse signals from linear measurements in a low-dimensional subspace. This problem is a fundamental topic in compressed sensing, which falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also introduces a new family of sparse measurement matrices associated with low-complexity recovery algorithms, which involves the use of sparse-graph codes. This connects the paper to the area of graph theory and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also analyzes the computational complexity of the proposed design, which is related to the field of computational complexity theory (cs.CC) and machine learning (cs.LG). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the proposed design in packet-communication systems, which falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). Finally, the paper presents results on the stability of support recovery under finite signal-to-noise ratios, which is related to statistical learning theory (cs.SI).
